messages.message:
Feedback from one of our customers. In our APIs, we need to align our response codes to the Flow State.

For example, even if the job status is FAILED, we still get a 200 response.

I have explained that the status code is only to indicate a successful request and the status of the flow was successfully retrieved. The flow state does not decide this.

However, is it something that should be looked into?

cc: @Aimé @Seb
https://instabase.atlassian.net/jira/polaris/projects/PFR/ideas/view/372748?selectedIssue=PFR-250 - In case anyone wants to add additional insights from other customers to this ticket
+1 a lot have clients have asked this in past as well.
@Aakash Tewari - Please add insight to ticket and detail which customesr! :slightly_smiling_face:
In the new APIs being built currently, we are using the correct response codes but I'm not aware of an effort to go back and update existing APIs.

Yeah, we shouldn’t be changing any existing APIs, we should be providing compatibility as best we can. So this would have to be V2 APIs, and also any new ones in V1 start using them. We’ll be rolling out guidelines/standards for V2 in Q2 (file-service v2 APIs in 22.08)

So the reason we haven’t just updated the old APIs to return proper status codes is because we assumed it might break customer solutions if we changed the response code from 200 to the right one. Is this assumption _actually true_?
